noun.description: A liquid made of shellac dissolved in alcohol, or of synthetic substances, that dries to form a hard protective coating for wood, metal, etc.
The sap of the lacquer tree used to varnish wood or other materials.
A solution sprayed on to a person's hair to keep it in place; hairspray.

examples: choose from brushed or lacquered copper

origin: Late 16th century (denoting lac): from obsolete French lacre sealing wax, from Portuguese laca (see lac).
